document_data.name: Dragon Breath
document_data.mainbody: '''Dragon breath''', or '''breath weapon''',) was a term used to refer to a special ability that was inherent to [[dragon]]s and the majority of [[dragonkind]], even those who merely had draconic ancestry.

Nature of Breath.Biological:
[[File:Themberchaud breath.gif|thumb|273px|''The red dragon [[Themberchaud]] unleashes his own fire breath in glorious motion capture.'']]
In [[true dragon]]s, the elemental or magical energies that granted a dragon their breath weapon were said to be generated by the heart and suffused throughout their body within the blood. The source was previously thought to be a large blood vessel called the '''fundamentum''', or '''draconis fundamentum''',<ref> but that merely channeled energy from the heart to a chamber in the gizzard. This organ stored a dragon's magical energies until they were needed to be unleashed as dragon breath.

Some breath types required an intrinsic temperature, which was maintained internally by the elemental or magical energy that flowed through a dragon's bloodstream. While other breath types, such as [[acid]], didn't have any such necessities.<ref> Additionally, dragon eggs were inherently resistant to harm from the breath weapon of their parents, though this resistance waned the closer they came to hatching.<ref><ref>
Nature of Breath.Magic:
Dragon breath had an inherently magical nature to it. Some believed that the [[magic]] permeating the [[Prime Material plane]] empowered it. as well as [[metallic dragon|metallics]], were each imbued with [[elemental magic]] and their breath weapon was a manifestation of that elemental energy.

Sometimes, a dragon's breath could be affected by the magic that permeated within their lairs. Such as clinging to and lingering on those afflicted by it or recharging at an incredible rate.

Some individual dragons and creatures of draconic heritage were capable of channeling the destructive energy of their breath into some other magical or supernatural effect.<ref> For example, with sufficient practice some dragons were capable of shaping their breath weapon into a bipedal, elemental creature known as an [[animated breath]]. 

There were a variety of [[spell]]s that acted upon dragon breath. Such effects included [[compel breath|compelling]] a dragon to exude their breath, [[diminish breath weapon|diminish]]ing a breath's effectiveness, [[suppress breath weapon|suppressing]] a dragon breath entirely, or [[alter breath weapon|altering]] its appearance and properties.{{cite book/Cult of the Dragon|94-95}} And some [[:category:draconic spells|draconic spells]]—that being, spells unique to dragonkind—required the use of dragon breath to cast, such as ''[[dispelling breath]]''.

There also existed spells that could protect someone against dragon breath. The [[Red Wizards of Thay]] had the spell ''[[protection from breath weapon, dragon]]''.

document_data.History:
On [[Toril]], some scholars from [[Candlekeep]] proposed the [[proto-dragon|proto-dragon theory]], claiming that the dragons of their world gradually developed breath weapons through evolution. This theory purported that a common ancestor, [[ignidraco]], developed a digestive tract that allowed them to regurgitate their own intestinal gas and ignite it with an enzymatic, hypergolic reaction in the back of their throats.<ref> The proto-dragon theory went on to claim that the ancestors of [[green dragon]]s and [[black dragon]]s developed their breath weapons from further modifying their digestive tracts.

There were many detractors to the proto-dragon theory, who pointed out that it could not fully explain the myraid of other elemental and non-elemental breath weapons that dragons possessed.

Notable Producers.True Dragons:
* There were a number of chromatic and metallic species of dragons that had similar types of dragon breath.
* Crossbreed dragons, those born through the mating of two different species, could potentially develop a breathe weapon that was a combination of both their parents'.<ref>
* The three-headed species [[dzalmus]] had a breath weapon that was a life-draining gas, though only one of its heads could unleash it at a time.{{Cite dragon/163/A Hoard for the Horde}}
* [[Chaos dragon]]s possessed two breath weapons, one that was [[confusion]]-inducing gas and another that was a line of energy. What this energy was always varied, with not even the chaos dragon knowing what it would breath out. Among the recorded possibilities were acid, cold, electricity, and sonic energy.<ref>
* [[Ethereal dragon]]s had a breath weapon that was a cone of pure force, which uniquely could affect even creatures on the [[Ethereal plane]].
* [[Hellfire wyrm]]s had a breath weapon that was a cone of [[hellfire]], a magical fire that was unique to its homeplane of [[Baator]].
* [[Mist dragon]]s possessed two breath weapons, one that was a caustic slime that induced nausea and another that was a scalding cone of mist.
* The [[Radiant dragon (planar)|radiant dragon]]s of [[Mount Celestia]] possessed two breath weapons, one that was a line of pure force that they reserved for earnest battles and another that was a blinding cone of radiant light, the latter of which they reserved for situations they wished to diffuse without causing harm.
* The [[radiant dragon]]s of [[wildspace]] had a breath weapon that was pure force, said to be similar to the spell ''[[magic missile]]'' but far more powerful. This could be exuded as one large, focused pulse or as six smaller pulses.
* [[Rust dragon]]s possessed two breath weapons, one that was acid and another that was an extremely corrosive liquid.
* [[Salt dragon]]s had a breath weapon that was a cone of [[salt|sodium chloride crystals]].{{Cite dragon/248/The Missing Dragons|26-28}}
* [[Styx dragon]]s possessed two breath weapons, one that was acid and another that was an intelligence draining gas.
* [[Tarterian dragon]]s possessed two breath weapons, one that was a line of pure force and another that was a cone of gas which sapped the will of its targets, an effect similar to the spell ''[[crushing despair]]''.
* The exceedingly rare [[time dragon]]s possessed two breath weapons. One was a line of pure chronal energy, causing any creature or object struck by it to age, while the other was a wave that caused creatures to temporarily disappear, expunging them from time for a few seconds or even minutes.{{Cite dragon/359/Time Dragon}}
Notable Producers.Lesser Dragons:
* [[Dragon turtle]]s had a breath weapon that was a cone of scalding steam.
* The three-headed [[draken]] species could breath {{SIAdj|60|ft|adj=long}} bolts of lightning. They could do this twice per day from each of their heads, but only from one of them at a time.{{Cite dragon/146/The Dragon's Bestiary: All dragons, great and small|26-27}}
* [[Dread linnorm]]s, a two-headed species of [[linnorm]], had a distinct breath weapon for each of its heads. One breathed fire, the other a freezing wind.
* [[Elemental drake]]s, with the exception of [[smoke drake]]s, all lacked a breath weapon.
* [[Faerie dragon]]s had a gaseous breath weapon that induced feelings of euphoria.
* Smoke drakes possessed two forms of breath weapon, a blinding cloud of smoke and a hazy cloud filled with burning, white-hot embers.
* [[Space drake]]s possessed a similar breath weapon to the radiant dragons of wildspace.
* [[Stygian linnorm]]s uniquely had a breath weapon that was a mixture of acid and water from the [[River Styx]].{{Cite dungeon/149/Enemies of My Enemy|84-85}}
Notable Producers.Dragonkind:
[[File:Chris dien dragonborn NWMMO.jpg|thumb|250px|''A male dragonborn using his fire breath.'']]
[[File:Chimerabattle.png|thumb|220x220px|''A chimera's draconic head unleashes its fiery dragon breath.'']]
* The hybrid species known as [[chimera]]e,{{cite book/Cult of the Dragon|99}} [[dracolisk]]s, [[gorgimera]]e, [[mantidrake]]s, and [[wyvern drake]]s could all exude a breath weapon.{{cite dragon/170/Crossing Dragons With Everything|19-20,22,24}} In the case of dracimerae, mantidrakes, and wyvern drakes this was dependent upon what chromatic ancestry they had. Most commonly, a chimera had a draconic head that resembled a red dragon and thus exuded a fire breath, while gorgimerae always had a red draconic head.
* Most [[dragonborn]] were capable of exuding some type of dragon breath. The type of breath weapon was dependent upon what chromatic, metallic, or [[gem dragon|gem draconic]] ancestry the dragonborn had. Regardless of its origin, it was typically as powerful as that of a [[wyrmling]] of the same type.{{Cite dragon/388/Winning Races: Dragonborn|38}}
* Most [[half-dragon]]s were capable of exuding some type of dragon breath. Like dragonborn, the type of breath weapon was dependent upon the creature's draconic ancestry.<ref>
* [[Weredragon]]s could exude a limited dragon breath whose effects varied depending upon what type of dragon they resembled.
Notable Producers.Undead:
* Dragons resurrected as lesser forms of undead lost their breath weapons, such as [[skeleton dragon|skeletons]] and [[zombie dragon|zombies]],<ref><ref> though some sources claimed that zombies retained a weaker version of their breath weapon.<ref>
* [[Dracolich]]s retained the breath they had in life,<ref> but were required to eat in order to refuel it.<ref>
* The [[Ghost dragon|ghosts]] of dragons had their own unique form of breath that was a cone of gray mist, which sometimes took the form of a ghostly parody of the breath they had in life.<ref><ref><ref>
* [[Hoarder dragon]]s retained the type of breath they had while alive, but with an added spray of pelting [[coin]]s.{{Cite web enhancement/New Draconic Monsters}}
